name: Slow Cooker Jambalaya (Vegan)
author: Maggie Huffman
summary: A good meal to freeze and throw in the slow cooker on a busy day. I prefer the rice cooked separately. You can substitute Creole seasoning for the Cajun seasoning and bok choy for the celery, if desired.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste
1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice
8 ounces smoked vegan sausage, cut into 2-inch slices
½ large green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Drizzle the bottom of a 4-quart slow cooker crock with olive oil
Stir tomatoes with juice, seitan, sausage, onion, green bell pepper, celery, vegetable broth, garlic, miso paste, Cajun seasoning, thyme, and oregano into crock
Add rice to the crock and cook on High until rice is cooked through, about 30 minutes more
